abstract.p: Jordache Enterprises will revive original television commercial that introduced Jordache brand of designer jeans; 1979 spot, which featured jingle, 'You've Got the Look,' is scheduled to begin running on Oct 30 on New York TV stations and continue appearing through Nov 19 (S)

block.p: The 1970's nostalgia trend is claiming another convert as Jordache Enterprises said it would bring back the original television commercial that introduced the Jordache brand of designer jeans.

The 1979 spot, which featured a jingle, ''You've Got the Look,'' that can still be sung by many who lived through the decade, is scheduled to begin running on Monday on New York TV stations like WABC and continue appearing through Nov. 19. The commercial showed a young woman wearing skintight jeans who danced in a period disco and modeled for a fashion photographer.

The 1979 spot, which featured a jingle, ''You've Got the Look,'' that can still be sung by many who lived through the decade, is scheduled to begin running on Monday on New York TV stations like WABC and continue appearing through Nov. 19. The commercial showed a young woman wearing skintight jeans who danced in a period disco and modeled for a fashion photographer.

Michael Riego, vice president for advertising at Jordache in New York, said the revival of the spot would promote the introduction of Jordache Originals, a brand of women's jeans similar in cut and fit to the original Jordaches. The commercial may run again nationally, Mr. Riego said.
